column1: 8 pts - You identified the marketing function as a potential area to benefit from scrum/sprint methodologies, but the explanation could be more specific on how it would operate within that function.

10 pts - Some vagueness in description, but largely OK. Good effort in explaining the scrum/sprint and kanban methodologies for marketing and delivery functions. Keep working on providing more specific details.

5 pts - Overly general description of poor fit; not specific to this function.

Comment: You mentioned that kanban is not suitable for marketing due to its repetitive nature, but you could provide more specific reasons why it's a poor fit for this function.
10 pts - You clearly identified the delivery function as the one that could benefit the most from implementing kanban methodologies. Good job!
12 pts - Very complete and clear description of how kanban could operate. Great job explaining the process and its benefits for the delivery function. Keep up the good work!

7 pts - Some vagueness or incompleteness in discussion of fit. 

Your response provided a good explanation of how scrum/sprint could benefit the marketing function, but the discussion on why it is a poor fit for the delivery function was not as clear. Keep up the good work and try to provide more specific details in future responses.

5 pts - Selected bias is clearly relevant to this situation.

Great job identifying the Availability Heuristic as a relevant bias for this situation. Your explanation and suggestion for addressing it are well thought out. Keep up the good work!

6 pts - Noticeable errors or misunderstanding in the definition.

Your description of the Availability Heuristic is somewhat unclear, and it would be helpful to provide a more concise and accurate definition. Keep working on refining your understanding of cognitive biases.

Rating: 10/10

Comment: Good job on describing the potential problems and biases. Just make sure to provide more specific details in your explanations. Keep up the good work!
8/10 - Your description of the possible steps and actions is reasonable, but could use a bit more detail. Keep up the good work and try to provide more specific examples in the future.
